description.narrative: Coalitions for Change (CfC) is the successor of the Philippine Australia Community Assistance Program (PACAP) and will provide a framework to facilitate partnerships among civil society, government and the private sector to address selected reform issues of the new AusAID's Development Assistance Strategy (DAS) for the Philippines. It will also work for a strengthened civil society participation to improve transparency, accountability and responsiveness in government to better meet the needs of its citizens particularly the marginalized sectors. CfC will: bring together government and civil society as well as private sector to work on selected reform areas. Each coalition will be created to achieve a specific reform objective, and to assist government to meet the needs of marginalised sectors; generate and use empirical evidence to support the desired changes; and build the capacity of coalitions members to constructively engage with each other to bring about the desired change.
